Get MERRA-2 grid

Source: R/locid.R
getGrid.Rd

Get MERRA-2 grid

getGrid(
  type = "points",
  class = "sp",
  locid = NULL,
  lon = c(-180, 180),
  lat = c(-90, 90)
)

Arguments

type

type of grid-data to return, spatial points ("points") or polygons ("poly")
class

class of object to return, spatial ("sp"), simple feature ("sf"), or data.frame ("df")
lon

range of longitude
lat

range of latitude

Value

Returns object with MERRA-2 grid information

Examples

x <- getGrid()
head(x)

#>       coordinates locid      lon lat
#> 1     (-180, -90)     1 -180.000 -90
#> 2 (-179.375, -90)     2 -179.375 -90
#> 3  (-178.75, -90)     3 -178.750 -90
#> 4 (-178.125, -90)     4 -178.125 -90
#> 5   (-177.5, -90)     5 -177.500 -90
#> 6 (-176.875, -90)     6 -176.875 -90
getGrid("poly", "sf")

#> Converting sp object to simple feature (sf) format
#> Simple feature collection with 207936 features and 5 fields
#> geometry type:  POLYGON
#> dimension:      XY
#> bbox:           xmin: -180.3125 ymin: -90.25 xmax: 179.6875 ymax: 90.25
#> CRS:            +proj=longlat +datum=WGS84 +no_defs

#>    locid V1 V2      lon lat                       geometry

#> 2      2  2  1 -179.375 -90 POLYGON ((-179.6875 -90.25,...
#> 3      3  3  1 -178.750 -90 POLYGON ((-179.0625 -90.25,...
#> 4      4  4  1 -178.125 -90 POLYGON ((-178.4375 -90.25,...
#> 5      5  5  1 -177.500 -90 POLYGON ((-177.8125 -90.25,...
#> 6      6  6  1 -176.875 -90 POLYGON ((-177.1875 -90.25,...
#> 7      7  7  1 -176.250 -90 POLYGON ((-176.5625 -90.25,...
#> 8      8  8  1 -175.625 -90 POLYGON ((-175.9375 -90.25,...
#> 9      9  9  1 -175.000 -90 POLYGON ((-175.3125 -90.25,...
#> 10    10 10  1 -174.375 -90 POLYGON ((-174.6875 -90.25,...
getGrid(lon = c(-70, -60), lat = c(30, 40), class = "df")

#> # A tibble: 357 x 3
